intro: Goeppertia lanata, commonly known as the woolly arrowroot, is a tropical plant native to South America. It belongs to the Marantaceae family and is characterized by its striking, velvety leaves that are covered in fine, white hairs. The plant typically grows as an evergreen perennial, often reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its foliage is often used in ornamental horticulture due to its aesthetic appeal. Goeppertia lanata thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot.
